title: Helping Bronze players improve, EP 9.
body:
Its a shame, almost had a perfect run with this guy!
Oh well.

If you are bronze and want some help, let me know.
Hopefully I can get LoLreplay to be able to send game files.
So if you have LoLreplay, try sending your recorded ranked games to-
mailto:YaseiDoubutsu@Outlook.com
(If that even worked, my youtube, about, down the bottom, should be an email link)

replies.body: Lol you didn't tell me you recorded that match, if you were online at the time a little feedback then would of been nice like you always do but oh well. Thanks anyways {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

lol sorry XD
I was a bit rushed and stuff.
I don't seem to be able to play league anymore as my streets Internet connection is extremely bad.
And I have 3 other house mates to contend with.

Sorry I seemed a little rush, I would have liked to have done a lot better with this one.
and I lapsed and didn't give you advice on certain things :(
Haha it's ok my internet was bad that game as well, but hey what can you do :/

For someone whos internet was bad you did well.
I hate off games like this, it sucks so much.

Just letting you know I wont be able to play league for god knows how long :(
So Im gonna try and upload an Ori and the blind forest ep a day.

looking over someones game and saying all the things he does wrong isn't going to help them. you're saying things that are relevant to that one game,  
eg. he tried to fight the renek when renek was 6. you emphasis that renekton has ult etc. but you didn't bring up how important level differentials are, to help him with further games, he may take into account a stronk level 6 renekton power spike but what he needs to know is never fight when you're lvl 5 vs lvl 6, with few circumstances where its ok. 

a lot of what you're telling his is to do with the certain game, and assuming you're coaching bronze players i don't think they'd be able to apply what you say to every game.

Your game knowledge is nub af as well. assuming you're plat/gold
